name: St. Hormisdas
summary: Hormisdas was Bishop of Rome from 514 to 523. He is best known for ending the Acacian schism, which had divided the Eastern and Western Churches for 35 years. He sent a formula of faith (the Formula of Hormisdas) to Constantinople, which was accepted by Emperor Justin I and Patriarch John II, reuniting the Churches. He was the father of Pope Silverius.
